question: When can a Speaker of Lok Sabha be removed before the expiry of his term?
option1: If the Prime Minister decides so
option2: If both the houses of Parliament pass a resolution to this effect
option3: If the President recommends the Prime Minister
option4: If the Lok Sabha passes a resolution to this effect
answer: If the Lok Sabha passes a resolution to this effect
explanation: Article 94(c) of the Constitution of India says that the Speaker or the Deputy Speaker may be removed from his office by a resolution of the House of people passed by a majority of all the then members of the house.
